entry.title: 🔵 Building Multi-Tool Research Agents: Amazon Bedrock Generative AI Hub and Strands SDK
entry.content:
Discover how to build multi-tool research agents that combine the enterprise-grade security of SAP's GenAI Hub with the cutting-edge capabilities of Amazon Bedrock models, including the Anthropic Claude and Amazon Nova family. In this session, you'll learn to create intelligent agents that can perform complex research, tool calling, and agentic workflows using the Strands Agents SDK framework. We'll demonstrate how SAP's centralized AI core seamlessly integrate with Amazon's foundation models from Bedrock to deliver compliant, scalable AI solutions on SAP BTP. From basic model consumption through REST APIs to building orchestrated agent workflows that can search, extract, and synthesize web data, you'll gain practical skills to implement AI agents in your SAP ecosystem. Whether you're a developer, ML engineer, or data scientist, this session provides the technical foundation and sample code needed to accelerate your AI agent development.

Speakers

  • Pfister, Michelle Mei-Li
  •  Arellano, Abraham

entry.title: Kickstart Your SAP BTP Journey
entry.content:
All you need to know and where to start

You may have come across articles, presentations, interviews or discussions about SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). You heard the term quite often, but you might still be asking:  

  • What exactly is SAP BTP?
  • Why is SAP BTP important?
  • And how do I begin exploring SAP BTP’s potential?
  • How does SAP BTP fit into the clean core strategy?

You’re now at the right place.

Whether you're a decision maker looking to drive IT strategy, an IT professional building solutions, a business user focused on innovation, or part of the academic community exploring cutting-edge technologies, this post is your launchpad into the world of SAP BTP.

Curious where you fit in? Keep reading to discover the tools, learning paths, and support SAP BTP offers for every IT role: from developers and architects to students, educators, and decision makers.

No matter your background or goals, there’s a starting point tailored just for you.

 

What We’ll Cover Here

  1. What Is SAP BTP?
  2. Why SAP BTP Matters
  3. SAP BTP and clean core
  4. Try Before You Buy: Trials & Pricing Models
  5. Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?
  6. SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role
  7. Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates
  8. Start building today!

 

What is SAP BTP?

SAP BTP is an intuitive, modern development and innovation platform for both professional IT and business users. It is a unified platform that brings quickly together everything you need to build any idea or business vision to life, extending, and integrating existing business applications, whether they’re SAP or not.

With self-service data discovery, modeling, planning, and analytics for business users in a governed environment, it provides integration solutions to connect and streamline applications and processes across the entire enterprise, offering pre-built business content like built-in data products, integrations, workflows, app templates, and AI services.

Here’s what’s in the toolbox:

  • App Development & Automation: Rapidly develop applications or automate processes using low-code/no-code tools or opt for professional-code development when advanced customization and control are required
  • Data & Analytics: Turn your data into decisions with built-in analytics and planning tools.
  • Integration: Connect SAP or non-SAP systems like a pro.
  • Artificial Intelligence: Infuse AI into your workflows, apps, and decisions.
  • Platform Foundation: Secure, scalable, and ready for hybrid cloud environments.

Simply put, SAP BTP enables you to innovate and stay relevant by building on established foundations.

 

Why SAP BTP Matters?

Because digital transformation is not just a trend, it’s essential for adaptability and resilience, a.k.a. survival.

With SAP BTP, you can:

  • Automate repetitive tasks and free up time for real work.
  • Connect all of your systems, so they integrate.
  • Build custom apps tailored to your business needs and vision.
  • Use AI to make smarter decisions, faster.
  • Connect and harmonize all your data, eliminating data silos
  • Get mission-critical insights from your data without a background in data science

And the best part? You don’t have to start from scratch.
SAP BTP offers thousands of pre-built content packages, from application or automation templates to integration flows to dashboards to AI services.

 

SAP BTP and clean core

Clean core is a set of guiding principles that support continuous business transformation by designing agile, innovative and efficient ERP systems. The principles focus on building resilient business processes and extensions supported by seamless integration, efficient operations, and data quality.

Central to the clean core strategy are Side-by-side extensions, powered by SAP BTP.

Side-by-side extensions allow organizations to enhance their SAP landscapes without directly modifying the core SAP S/4HANA system: instead of embedding custom code within the core, new functionalities, integrations, and custom applications are developed and deployed independently on SAP BTP.

This approach leverages SAP BTP's robust services, including various runtime environments (like Cloud Foundry, Kyma, and the ABAP Environment), development tools (like SAP Business Application Studio and CAP), and critical integration services (like SAP Integration Suite and SAP Event Mesh). Connectivity is securely handled by tools like the SAP Cloud Connector for on-premise systems and the Destination Service, ensuring seamless data exchange via standard APIs and business events from the core.

 

Try Before You Buy: Free Trials & Flexible Pricing Models
Not ready to commit? No problem

SAP BTP offers a 90-day free trial with access to 30+ services.

You can explore, experiment, and learn at your own pace how to build, deploy, and integrate with a full suite of platform services.

Start here your free trial of SAP Business Technology Platform.

When you're ready to scale, you’ve got options:

  • Free Tier: Build small apps, pay only for what you use.
  • Pay-As-You-Go: Great for dynamic needs and innovation projects.
  • Enterprise Agreement: Predictable pricing for known use cases.

Explore all the possibilities SAP BTP unlocks. We’ve outlined the opportunities below:

 

Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?

Thousands of organizations, from global enterprises to emerging startups, are already leveraging SAP BTP to transform their operations. Let their success inspire you.
They are using SAP BTP to:

  • Automate supply chains
  • Personalize customer experiences
  • Streamline HR processes
  • Build AI-powered finance tools ... and achieve much more.

With over 33,000 customers and 3,200 partners, you'll be in excellent company.

See how SAP BTP customers are achieving a measurable impact across industries and lines of business.

 

SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role

Here’s your go-to list of resources to get rolling, matched to your role:

Note: This table is a starting point. Resource-role mappings are suggestions. Feel free to explore beyond your role based on your needs and interests. Find below what each of the resources has to offer.

SAP Discovery Center - Learn about SAP BTP Services in detail:

  • Start your experience with Guided Missions to bring real life use-cases to life
  • Reference established architectures patterns to guide your design and implementation
  • Understand how SAP BTP’s AI capabilities are used to infuse AI features into SAP’s solution portfolio
  • Create an estimate of your services to get a first impression about the usage cost.

SAP BTP Learning - Free learning journeys tailored to your role and pace:

  • Familiarize yourself with the basic concepts of SAP BTP.
  • Get enabled.
  • Plan your implementation.
  • Prepare for your go-live.

SAP BTP Guidance Framework - Provides a central access point for architects, developers, and administrators to build and run enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP:

  • Decision Guides: Quickly identify the best technology options for your specific needs.
  • Reference Architectures: Explore solution templates to effectively design and build on BTP, understanding key concepts and capabilities.
  • Methodologies: Access guided approaches to boost your cloud technology maturity, spanning both technical and organizational aspects.
  • Technology Recommendations: Evaluate and choose the right implementation options across various technology domains.
  • DevOps Principles: Empower your development and operations teams to achieve greater efficiency.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub  - Kickstart your projects with ready-to-use Business Content available for SAP BTP:

  • Integration: Access over 4,000 pre-built objects, including integration flows, scripts, value mappings, and message mappings, to streamline your connections with SAP Integration Suite
  • Development & Automation: Accelerate your projects with approximately 650 pre-built workflows, automations, applications, templates, and actions ready for use with SAP Build
  • Analytics: Jump-start your data insights using pre-built dashboards, stories, and data models specifically designed for SAP BTP's analytics capabilities
  • Information: Explore a rich repository of resources, including APIs, events, CDS views, business objects, interfaces, adapters, process blueprints, and SAP-validated partner use cases.

SAP Community - Connect with fellow SAP BTP users, ask questions and share ideas, get help and help others.

 

Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates

SAP Release Navigator - Keep up with the latest innovations and updates across SAP BTP, track new features and plan your adoption.

Road Map Explorer - Discover SAP’s product strategies and planned innovations with this go-to interactive tool. It highlights key advancements and offers a robust planning horizon, helping you precisely detail your transformation journey.

Strategy White Paper for SAP BTP - When you are ready to get deeper, discover more with SAP’s strategy for SAP BTP.

 

Start Building today!

Start your journey today with the SAP BTP Trial or explore your first mission at the SAP Discovery Center.

Got further questions? Drop them below and let’s build something amazing, together.

entry.title: How to create a new ship-to address and assign it to delivery on creation using exit in ECC?
entry.content:
User exit: MV50AFZ1

Routine: userexit_save_document_prepare

DATA: ls_adrc TYPE addr1_data,
ls_adrc_new TYPE addr1_data,
l_h32 TYPE guid_32,
l_handle TYPE szad_field-handle,
l_ag TYPE adrc-addr_group,
l_ret TYPE szad_field-returncode,
l_ref TYPE addr_ref,
l_nadrnr TYPE adrc-addrnumber,
lt_errtab TYPE TABLE OF addr_error WITH DEFAULT KEY.

LOOP AT xvbpa ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_vbpa>) WHERE parvw = 'WE'. " Ship-To
"Read current address
SELECT SINGLE * FROM adrc INTO @DATA(wa_adrc)
WHERE addrnumber = @<fs_vbpa>-adrnr.

MOVE-CORRESPONDING wa_adrc TO ls_adrc."Copy default address values
"modify address fields here
"ls_adrc-street
"ls_adrc-str_suppl1
"ls_adrc-str_suppl2
"ls_adrc-str_suppl3
"ls_adrc-city1
"ls_adrc-post_code1
"ls_adrc-region
"ls_adrc-country

" Generate temporary handle
CALL FUNCTION 'GUID_CREATE'
IMPORTING
ev_guid_32 = l_h32.
l_handle = l_h32+0(16).

SELECT SINGLE addr_group FROM adrc INTO l_ag
WHERE addrnumber = <fs_vbpa>-adrnr.

"Insert new address
CALL FUNCTION 'ADDR_INSERT'
EXPORTING
address_data = ls_adrc
address_group = l_ag
address_handle = l_handle
IMPORTING
address_data = ls_adrc_new
returncode = l_ret
TABLES
error_table = lt_errtab
EXCEPTIONS
OTHERS = 1.
IF sy-subrc = 0."Successful New Address insert

SELECT SINGLE appl_table appl_field appl_key addr_group owner
FROM adrv
INTO (l_ref-appl_table,l_ref-appl_field,l_ref-appl_key,l_ref-addr_group,l_ref-owner)
WHERE addrnumber = <fs_vbpa>-adrnr.

CALL FUNCTION 'ADDR_NUMBER_GET'
EXPORTING
address_handle = l_handle " Handle used in address creation
address_reference = l_ref " Optional: reference object
IMPORTING
address_number = l_nadrnr
EXCEPTIONS
address_handle_not_exist = 1
internal_error = 2
parameter_error = 3
OTHERS = 4.
IF sy-subrc = 0."Successful New Address number

CALL FUNCTION 'ADDR_MEMORY_SAVE'
EXPORTING
execute_in_update_task = ' '
EXCEPTIONS
address_number_missing = 1
person_number_missing = 2
internal_error = 3
database_error = 4
reference_missing = 5
OTHERS = 6.
IF sy-subrc = 0."Successful save of New Address number
<fs_vbpa>-adrnr = l_nadrnr.
ENDIF.

ENDIF."End of if Successful New Address number

ENDIF."End of if Successful New Address insert
ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Oman localization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud: what matters for Implementation and beyond
entry.content:
If you are rolling out SAP S/4HANA Cloud in Oman, localization is not an afterthought—it’s your go‑live runway. SAP provides a dedicated Oman node on the Help Portal that consolidates scope, configuration, and reporting activities aligned to local law and practice.

What’s in scope

  • VAT: Generate the quarterly VAT Return using Run Statutory Reports, with predefined tax boxes for sales and purchase scenarios as well as reverse‑charge coverage for imported goods/services. You can analyze, adjust, export, and manage correction phases directly from the reporting task. 
     
  • Withholding tax (Form 18): Declaration focused on payments to foreign suppliers, supported by a guided sequence—manage items, review, clear, prepare—plus parameters such as principal‑officer details. 
     
  • Cash flow statement: Produce the OM_CASHFLOW (indirect method) via the same Document and reporting compliance framework, using the OMCF financial statement version. 
     
  • Official document numbering (ODN): Enforce unique fiscal‑year serials for invoices and related notes through country key OM, document classes (OIN/OCN/ODN), number groups, and ranges. 
     
  • Postdated checks (PDC): End‑to‑end handling—receive, present to bank/vendor, clear/bounce, reverse, and track history—using the Bills of Exchange apps. 
     
  • Sales billing forms: Predelivered Oman templates for customer invoices and credit memos streamline compliant output.

Set‑up essentials
Start with master data: maintain VAT registration numbers for company codes and business partners (format: OM + 10 digits). If applicable, define HSN/SAC codes and apply material tax indicators/classifications. Establish reporting entities and categories you’ll run most often—OM_RPG_ENT, OM_VAT_RET, OM_WHT_FORM18_DCL, OM_CASHFLOW—and complete activity‑specific parameters (for example, principal‑officer data for Form 18). 

Operate & report
Your daily driver is Run Statutory Reports: prepare the run, analyze and adjust, preview/ export, then (manually) submit to authorities and update the submission status. When you need corrections, open a new phase for a full or delta rerun as appropriate. 

Looking Ahead: E-Invoicing in Oman
Oman is moving toward mandatory e-invoicing, with a expected phased rollout starting in Q3 2026 most probably under the PEPPOL 5-corner model. This shift would require businesses to adopt structured invoice formats and integrate with accredited service providers.

Please read the blog for more details.

SAP Plans to deliver an e-invoicing solution for Oman as part of its continuous localization roadmap. Customers can expect capabilities aligned with OTA requirements, leveraging SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for seamless integration and compliance.

For the latest details and planned delivery timelines, Subscribe and stay tuned to SAP Regulatory Change Manager. This is your single source for official updates on regulatory changes and SAP’s enablement plans.

Takeaway
With pre‑delivered content across VAT, withholding tax, cash flow, ODN, PDC, and billing forms, Oman localization helps you cut risk and standardize close and reporting. Bookmark the Oman Help Portal entry and use it as your implementation playbook. 

Ready to make your Oman rollout smooth and compliant? Dive into the SAP Help Portal for detailed guidance and keep an eye on the Regulatory Change Manager for e-invoicing updates. Got questions? Share them in the comments—we’d love to hear your perspective.

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Localization SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP S/4HANA localization as a self-service for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: What’s New in SAP Reference Architecture? [Summer Edition]
entry.content:
Before diving in, do you feel like you could use a quick refresher on SAP Reference Architecture? Then you should take a look at this Learning Journey: Exploring SAP Reference Content as Enterprise Architect. The journey is focused on how our Reference Business and Solution Architecture is part of the EA Framework (i), how it reflects the various E2E processes (ii), and how it is embedded into the respective tooling (iii). It is tailored for (aspiring) Enterprise Architects and anyone eager to explore our Reference Enterprise Architecture. Plus: After completing the journey and passing the quiz, participants will be granted a Badge. Happy Learning and sharing! 😊

 

SAP S/4HANA Breakdown in Modules

Let’s start with our first focus topic: The S/4HANA Breakdown by Modules. As you conduct business capability assessments or plan your transformation roadmap with recommended solution capabilities, you've likely encountered a familiar challenge. While many organizations rightly identify SAP S/4HANA as the central application supporting a vast number of business capabilities, a common question arises from business stakeholders and project teams alike: "That's great, but which part of the SAP S/4HANA solution is actually relevant here?"

For an Enterprise Architect mapping capabilities to applications, simply linking a capability like "Accounts Payable" to the high-level application "SAP S/4HANA" is often insufficient. They need to dig deeper for effective planning and want to understand which specific module within the S/4HANA Business Suite is required to deliver that capability. This level of detail is crucial in use cases such as scoping implementation projects, planning successors, and defining migration scenarios.

That's where the latest enhancement to the SAP Reference Architecture comes into play. This update moves beyond the high-level application view to provide a consistent, more granular breakdown of SAP S/4HANA into its constituent modules. For you as an architect and for your business stakeholders, this is a significant step forward, enabling more precise, transparent, and actionable architecture work.

To provide this clarity, we follow a structured, multi-level hierarchy, in line with the Application Component Hierarchy (ACH) for representing SAP S/4HANA solution components within our Enterprise Architecture models. Here, the solution component is at the top, followed by two levels of solution sub components. This approach is designed to be both logical from a business and technical standpoint.

  • Solution Component: The Application
    On the top we have the application. This is SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA.
  • Solution Sub Component Level 1: Business Grouping
    The first level provides a logical, business-centric grouping of functionalities. Following best practices, this level leverages the familiar RBA Business Domains you already know, such as Finance, Asset Management, Manufacturing, Sales and many more. We have also introduced an additional L1 category called “Cross Functionality” for capabilities that are centrally defined and used across many business functions, such as Pricing. It's important to note that this level does not reflect the technical structure within S/4HANA; rather, it organizes capabilities in a way that aligns with how you think about your business.
  • Solution Sub Component Level 2 (Module): Technical Building Block
    This is where we get into the technical substance. The second level represents the actual modules within SAP S/4HANA. These modules are subgroups within the Level 1 solution sub components and reflect the true technical structure of the solution. A module represents a group of solution capabilities that are technically bundled together and, in some cases, might be subject to separate pricing.

To ensure consistency and create a stable reference point, each of these Level 2 modules is mapped in a 1:1 relationship to an element in the ACH. The ACH is the official, tree-like structure within the SAP back-end system that organizes components by product and function from a business point of view. By anchoring our modules to this standard hierarchy, we ensure that our reference architecture remains synchronized with the product itself and allows other tools and functions to seamlessly connect and enrich the data. Learn more about the SAP Application Component Hierarchy here.

If you want to have a look at the SAP S/4HANA breakdown in modules yourself, you can do so in this Excel file. It also contains the link of the Solution Capabilities to the modules. The Excel file can be imported into SAP LeanIX. In the near future, the breakdown will also be available as standard in SAP LeanIX.

 

Extended Scope of Business Data Objects

As announced in the Spring Blog Post already, the SAP Reference Business Architecture now also covers Business Data Objects. With this addition, the SAP Reference Business Architecture increases its footprint in Data Architecture. And yes, with SAP Business Data Cloud the Domain of Data Architecture also becomes more and more important.

Let’s briefly repeat what Data architecture is all about: Data Architecture serves as a blueprint for how data is used. It is the high-level structure of data and data-related resources that acts as a framework for data throughout an organization, including models, rules, and standards. With efficient data architecture, organizations track the acquisition, movement, storage, security, and accessibility of data across their IT infrastructure. And this also depicts how we, as Enterprise Architects, can work with Business Data Objects: Business Data Objects are an integral part of Data Architecture. They can be defined as structured representations of business entities, such as orders or invoices, so that software systems can store, process, and exchange that information consistently.

Business Data Objects in the SAP Reference Business Architecture help to get greater transparency of how and which data flows across the different business processes. Business Data Objects are part of the SAP Business Capability Model and bound by Business Domain, meaning that Data Objects are systematically linked to Business Capabilities. This indicates for which Business Capability which Data Objects are required. Also, bear in mind, that one Business Data Object can be found in various Business So, on Business Area and Business Capability level, there can be overlaps.

When looking at the left-hand side of the below diagram, one can see that there is also a connection of Business Data Objects to Business Activities. The reason is that they can serve as input for or output of a Business Activity (e.g. when thinking of an “order” as Business Data Object)

 

Now the big news: Business Data Objects as part of the SAP Reference Architecture will soon be featured in the respective tooling. For now, users can refer to this publicly available Excel file, and import the content into the respective tool of choice, e.g. SAP LeanIX. While having Business Data Objects in the SAP Reference Architecture is a big step towards Data Architecture, the coverage of BDO’s is still increasing. We add Business Data Objects to the SAP Reference Architecture in a continuous manner.

Hint: If you are an architect and currently involved in Business Data Cloud, we highly recommend this webinar series, led by the SAP Enterprise Architecture Advisory Team and other knowledgeable and experienced architecture experts. You can find all the recordings and slides here: Recordings and Slides from webinar series 'Archite... - SAP Community


Industry Content

Industry reference content is one component of the SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework and it reflects SAP's deep industry expertise. Such content shows the integration of business processes and align them with SAP solutions relevant to specific industries. For example, the reference content is helping organizations to customize their business capabilities and processes to suit their very own industry-specific needs.

Using industry-specific reference architecture helps planning and executing transformations by utilizing pre-configured tools and aligning their processes with best practices and industry standards. Therefore, Enterprise Architects can derive significant advantages from industry content available through SAP Reference Architecture. They get comprehensive views, such as Product Maps and Solution Component Diagrams, allowing for holistic planning of system integration and deployment options, guide their transformation strategies, and ensure alignment with industry standards and best practices. Haven’t seen it yet? Check out the SAP Signavio Process Explorer here
 
For the time being, the SAP Reference Architecture is already available for a multitude of industries, which have been released over the past quarters. As of now, content for the following industries is live:

  • Consumer Industries including Retail, Consumer Products, Life Sciences, and Wholesale Distribution, with Agribusiness being added later this year.
  • Discrete Industries: including Automotive, High Tech, Industrial Manufacturing and Aerospace & Defense.
  • Energy & Natural Resources including Oil, Gas & Energy, Chemicals, Utilities, Mill Products, and Mining.
  • Public Services including Public Sector and Healthcare
  • Service Industries including Professional Services, Media, Travel & Transportation, Engineering Construction & Operations and Telecommunications, with Sports & Entertainment arriving later this year.
  • Besides that, there will be Financial Service content later this year, starting out with industry content for Banking.

To see industry content in action and explore how it is based in the Reference Architecture, make sure to check out the Enterprise Architecture: Automotive Example video.

If you are interested in learning more about Reference Business and Solution Architecture, feel free to reach out. Our team of Enterprise Architects is working continuously on elevating the SAP Reference Architecture. Kudos out to the teams within the SAP Global Content Group actively driving this!

Last but not least: Are you an Enterprise Architect and actively working with the SAP Reference Architecture? Then we would appreciate your feedback

entry.title: Re: RAP Behaviour Implementation get_*_features/get_*_aut...
entry.content:
If the Travel is open → Delete button is active.

If the Travel is cancelled → Delete button is greyed out, Update button also greyed out.

No messages are shown — just proper enablement/disablement.

CLASS zbp_travel DEFINITION PUBLIC FINAL CREATE PROTECTED.
PUBLIC SECTION.
INTERFACES if_abap_behv_impl.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zbp_travel IMPLEMENTATION.

METHOD get_instance_features.
LOOP AT keys ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_key>).

" Read status of the current Travel instance
SELECT SINGLE status
FROM ztravel
WHERE travel_id = @<ls_key>-travel_id
INTO @DATA(lv_status).

" Prepare feature result
APPEND VALUE #(
%tky = <ls_key>-%tky
%features-%delete =
COND #( WHEN lv_status = 'O' THEN if_abap_behv=>fc-o-enabled
ELSE if_abap_behv=>fc-o-disabled )
%features-%update =
COND #( WHEN lv_status = 'C' THEN if_abap_behv=>fc-o-disabled
ELSE if_abap_behv=>fc-o-enabled )
) TO result.

ENDLOOP.

" No need to fill reported here!
ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

Scenario

We still have the Travel entity.
We want to control authorizations:

A user with role TRAVEL_ADMIN → full access (update + delete).

A user with role TRAVEL_VIEWER → read-only, no update or delete.

CLASS zbp_travel DEFINITION PUBLIC FINAL CREATE PROTECTED.
PUBLIC SECTION.
INTERFACES if_abap_behv_impl.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zbp_travel IMPLEMENTATION.

METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
LOOP AT keys ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_key>).

" Check current user authorization (simplified example)
DATA(lv_is_admin) = cl_auth_check=>is_user_in_role( iv_role = 'TRAVEL_ADMIN' ).
DATA(lv_is_viewer) = cl_auth_check=>is_user_in_role( iv_role = 'TRAVEL_VIEWER' ).

" Prepare authorization result
APPEND VALUE #(
%tky = <ls_key>-%tky
%auth-%update =
COND #( WHEN lv_is_admin = abap_true THEN if_abap_behv=>auth-allowed
ELSE if_abap_behv=>auth-unauthorized )
%auth-%delete =
COND #( WHEN lv_is_admin = abap_true THEN if_abap_behv=>auth-allowed
ELSE if_abap_behv=>auth-unauthorized )
) TO result.

ENDLOOP.

" Again: leave reported empty
ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Say Goodbye to Overwrites: Experience Secure Dashboard Management with Edit Mode!
entry.content:
In the fast-paced environment of large organizations, multiple analysts often collaborate on a single dashboard, which can lead to accidental overwriting of edits and wasted effort. This lack of coordination makes it harder to enhance dashboards effectively. Fortunately, we have developed features to address these challenges.

A Seamless Solution for Enhanced Collaboration

Our edit mode and view mode are designed to facilitate seamless teamwork and eliminate common obstacles. With edit mode, analysts can work with confidence, knowing their contributions are safeguarded against concurrent changes, thanks to a locking mechanism. On the other hand, view mode offers business users an intuitive experience focused on filtering and data exploration.

 

How to Get Started

Getting started is a breeze. Simply open your dashboard, toggle on edit mode, make your desired changes, and save your updates to share with your team. This structured process guarantees that every modification is intentional and well-documented.

Capabilities Unlocked

  • Edit mode: Only one user can modify the dashboard at a time, preventing accidental overwrites and conflicting changes. This mode fosters transparency and teamwork, as other users are notified during editing. Plus, if your session times out or your connection drops, you are automatically switched to View Mode, freeing the dashboard for others.

  • View mode: Provides a consumer-focused interface for easy data filtering and exploration, tailored for business users who need direct, actionable insights. Users with the Consumer role can apply and remove filters to customize their view, gaining tailored insights without risking changes to the dashboard itself.

Key Benefits

  • Safeguard Edits: Analysts can focus on their work without the risk of overwriting someone else's contributions, ensuring every edit is preserved.
  • Reduced Overhead: The lock mechanism eliminates the need to coordinate edits manually, freeing up valuable time and resources.
  • Enhanced User Experience: View Mode provides business users with a streamlined way to interact with data, enabling effortless filtering and exploration.

These features show our commitment to providing a more efficient and user-friendly platform for process analyses, empowering organizations to collaborate effectively and work with confidence. 

Stay tuned for the release on September 23rd and get ready to elevate your dashboard interaction to the next level!

entry.title: Re: Posting Output Tax in Customer Down payment Request u...
entry.content:
With standard SAP limitations, FAZ billing type is configured with billing category P (down payment request) and posting status = noted item. This is hard‑coded to post only a noted item in FI — no tax lines, no revenue. The tax code in FAZ pricing is normally ignored for FI posting.

Given your legal requirement and the fact you are in KSA/UAE, check if SAP GCC localisation for “Advance Tax Invoice” is active and this is the cleanest, supported way. If not available, copy FAZ to a new invoice‑type billing document and configure pricing + account determination to post VAT at the advance stage. Ensure your final invoice pricing procedure is set to deduct the down payment from the taxable base.

entry.title: Re: BTP Service SAP Translation Hub - ABAP Texts transformation
entry.content:
Hi Patrick,
As you noticed, if your object list contains texts for which translations already exist in your ABAP system, SAP Translation Hub does not translate them again, but directly displays the existing translations with the Translation Provider set as ABAP. You can still edit those translations if required, but SAP Translation Hub does not directly make any changes to them, considering them already available and you are not charged for processing those texts.
To avoid sending content that is already translated in your ABAP system, you should configure your object list to include only the content you want to translate.

Please refer to the following documentation for information about the various options for creating object lists and consider the best approach for your needs: https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/ceb25152cb0d4adba664cebea2bf4670/4647dd3f02db6a81e10000000a155369.html?version=202210.002&locale=en-US

Information about how to merge and edit object lists is also available.

Please also ensure that your object list contains texts in one source language only. 

Tip: You might also consider installing the translation object detective which can support you in determining which objects contain texts you want to translate. Documentation available here: https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/ceb25152cb0d4adba664cebea2bf4670/88a3d3cbccf64601975acabaccdfde45.html?version=202210.002&locale=en-US
You can then use this information to create a local list (see https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/ceb25152cb0d4adba664cebea2bf4670/931091b61ce6482b9a40c1d68e93a29a.html?version=202210.002&locale=en-US) and subsequently create an object list based on the local list.

Hope this helps but feel free to contact our team at translationhub@sap.com if you would like to discuss our offering further.

entry.title: OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

  • During testing (Step 10), we were asked to select the “SAP SuccessFactors” application, but the option only works when “Administration Console” is selected.

Further testing, as per this guide, yielded the following:

  • We successfully called the /oauth2/token API and obtained an ID token from the Identity Authentication service.

  • We made a second API call to obtain an API access token using the ID token from the previous step.

  • However, using this access token, we are unable to access APIs in the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Getting the 401 authentication error while querying SuccessFactors OData APIs:

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"
    }
    }
    ************************

Key Requirements:

  • The official documentation suggests using grant_type=password, which we want to avoid for security reasons.

  • We intend to use grant_type=authorization_code so that users can log in via SSO through the front-end application, and their session can be used to access the APIs.

  • We would appreciate guidance on setting this up, specifically:

    1. How to configure the authentication flow for users logging in through the front-end application.

    2. How to configure it when an application (rather than users) needs to consume SuccessFactors APIs.

We request your help in setting this up correctly and securely. Leads to documentation/blog posts or any sort of help will be highly appreciated. 

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande @

Regards,
Pavan

entry.title: How-to export CI-DS Logs to external system
entry.content:
Is there any API which we can use to export SAP CI-DS logs to external system?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How-to export CI-DS Logs to external system
entry.content:
There are various log types in CI-DS:

  • SOAP API available:
    • Task or Process execution logs (trace, monitor, error)
  • API not available:
    • DS Agent logs: DSOnPremiseAgent log, job server logs, datastore specific logs (adapters, web services, RFC traces)
    • Security Log: Accessible from the CI-DS web interface in tab Administration -> Security Log

The task execution logs are the most commonly reviewed: trace, monitor, and error. There is a SOAP API available for CI-DS that can be used to extract those logs from active or finished tasks and processes.

Here are the general steps to interact with the SOAP API for that purpose.

  1. Make a call to "logon" to receive a sessionID
  2. Use that sessionID in a call to "getAllExecutedTasks2" to retrieve a list of runId's based on some criteria like task name or startDate.
  3. Use the sessionID and the list of runId's to make successive calls to "getTaskStatusByRunId2" to retrieve each page of each log for a given runId.
  4. Make a call to "logout" to end that sessionID.

entry.title: Re: Posting Output Tax in Customer Down payment Request u...
entry.content:
Try with the below approach

To have the system post VAT and customer A/R at the “down payment request” stage, you need to start from an invoice‑category billing type (e.g., copy F2) and adapt it for down payment use:

Copy an invoice billing type to ZFAZ_INV. Most importantly, you need to change the Billing Category to "M" here instead of "P"

In copying control (VTFA), link your sales order type/item category to ZFAZ_INV with:

  • Copying requirement 20 (down payment request logic).
  • Pricing type B or C so AZWR is determined.

Include AZWR in the pricing procedure before tax, with account key to deferred revenue/down payment clearing.

Adjust the billing plan date category to use ZFAZ_INV for the advance milestone.

entry.title: Business requirement to copy SME Evaluation Questionnaire comments into implementation task
entry.content:
We have a business requirement to make comments from the SME reviews transfer to the task they create. Business reports that there is a lot of good information and clear instructions being missed because comments are not readily visible in change execution tasks.      

--- Steps to Reproduce ---

  1. Create New MOC Change Request.
  2. MOC CR is created and MOC Activities are also generated by system.
  3. Once the Initial Evaluation Activities are completed SME Evaluation Activities are populated.
  4. Under SME Evaluation Activities there are mandatory questionnaire to be answered with Comments as optional. If the users provide some information or add valuation information to be considered while completing the implementation of MOC. The Comments added during SME Evaluation should get copied to the implementation Activities Notes Section.

  5. MOC evaluation dependent implementation tasks are added to MOC Issue according to BRF+ decision table DECISION_TABLE_ACTIVITIES_2_C. MOC calls BRF+ processing at the system status transition from APPROVE to IN-PROCESS in this situation.

    The requirement is to copy comments from triggering question into Note section of resulting implementation tasks.

     

    API is available to read BRF+ decision table.

entry.title: Re: service item in US localization sap b1
entry.content:
thank you Faraz.. it has been confusing but now I got the solution:

and for future reference, since there is not a 100% clear explanation anywhere, here the solution:

 

SAP B1 version 10.02

Non inventory or non stock items can be created in the Master Data Item marking the only Sale Item or/and Purchase Item, as Felipe explained

 

The accounting tab in the items groups appears only when "Advance G/L account determination" is disable in the General setting for the company code. If this option is enable, G/L accounts can be customized in the advance G/L determination section, otherwise configure the G/L account at item group level when item group is created/modified.

when the item is being used in a Sales Order, it is necessary to mark in the logistics tab the Confirmed option, so the delivery is not necessary and AR invoice can be done from the SO.

 

thank you all !

entry.content:

entry.title: Re: Cash-Flow Report with Document Types
entry.content:
@MELISKULBAY In the currently delivered content, there is no option to use the accounting document type as a filter in the reporting rule. It only supports GR document types and an addtional attributes.

This is a unique requirement—I’ve never seen CF reporting requirements based on accounting document types before. That said, there is a roadmap to enable multiple GR dimensions, and custom fields will eventually be available in the reporting items. However, I’m not sure when this is planned.  check the CIP request.

With the new GRPL concept, you can bring accounting document types into Group Reporting. If you follow this approach, the accounting document type  ( Custom) will be available in GR, and eventually you can leverage SAC reporting with a dedicated mapping process directly in the SAC model.

Accounting document type will have some minimal impact on data volumes, so please review this solution carefully with your customer and infrastructure teams.

entry.title: Requirement: WebI Waterfall Report – GL Account Causing Multivalue and Export Issues
entry.content:
We have developed a Waterfall report in Web Intelligence (WebI) using a cross-tab format to display monthly waterfall data. The report consists of two pages:

  • Summary Page: Displays Company Code and GL Account details.
  • Detailed Page: Displays additional fields such as IDs, amounts, GL Account, and other dimensions.

🧩 Problem Statement:

On the Detailed Page, when we include the GL Account column:

  • The volume of data increases significantly, causing performance issues.
  • When exporting to Excel, the file fails to open and throws a content error, even though the data appears clean.
  • If we remove the GL Account column, the Excel export works fine.
  • However, the business users do not accept removing GL Account from the report.

🛠️ Attempted Solution:

To avoid grouping by GL Account and reduce data volume:

  • I created a Detail object for GL Account based on a unique ID dimension from the universe.
  • This allowed me to add GL Account to the cross-tab without grouping.
  • The total amount matches between the Summary and Detailed pages.
  • However, the monthly breakdown amounts are mismatched, and #MULTIVALUE errors still appear under GL Account.

❓ What I Need Help With:

  • Is there any alternative approach to include GL Account in a cross-tab without grouping, and without triggering multivalue errors?

entry.title: ABAP Trial 2023 - Licence issues and Permanent Compiling issues
entry.content:
Dear all,

I installed SAP ABAP Trial 2023 in the last week. In the past I had already installed 1909 or one release higher. In the past, the application started comparatively quickly. Now - on the same environment - it requires three times the time. Anybody experiencing the same behaviour with 2023 compared to the former 2 releases?

More importantly and much more annoying are the following issues:

1. Licence issue:
When I had installed the trial in docker, and started the system, I wanted to login using the user developer and the initial password. This was not possible. The system message was "Logon not possible (Error in license check)

Obviously the license is already expired after the installation. No issue - in the installation description there is a good explanation how to renew the license. Having done this, it worked with the user developer. I could login. But... here is the issue:

Every time after a restart of the application the same issue comes up. And after every restart of the docker, the same procedure to renew the license has to be done compeletely, because the hardware key seems to change every time. And I have now clue why. It seems to be not sufficient to store the hardware key somewhere in a document and to quickly renew the license and reinstall the license file. No, you first need to login with the user SAP*, check the hardware key, which changes every time and then to renew the license file and reinstall that. Doing this every time after a restart is so annoyoing that I have concerns whehter this system is really usable for me.

Does anybody experienced the same issue? I have not experienced this behaviour using one of the former ABAP Trial releases. My first idea was: Well, I just keep the system up and running. But this also does not work either. When I don´t use the system, e.g. because I go to bed, the next day the system is not running any more. Obviously the container stops to work after some idle time. So I do need to restart the system whenever I want to use it and then the license issues comes up. Any idea how to solve this?

2. Issue Permanent compiling starting any transaction

Once I solved the license issue, I can login, but then the next issue comes up, which I also never experienced in the former releases. The system is compiling for every transaction. Every experience SAP guy will now say: Use transaction SGEN and compile one time and you have fixed it. I did so, no resolution.

These 2 issues are really annoying and make it impossible for me to work with the system. Does anybody know a solution for these two really nasty issues?


Thanks in advance for any help.


Best regards,

Joachim

P.S: As @JuliePlummer mentioned or asked for in different places, I tried to add or to choose the hashtag #ABAP_Trial here in SAP Managed Tags. There was no such has tag unfortunately...

entry.title: Re: Error message: FINOC165 and FINOC297 - Manage Cost Ce...
entry.content:
Please note that you cannot change the Profit Center in S/4HANA because, the profit center is part of the time‑dependent master data of a cost center. Once there are actual postings (even if reversed), the system protects the historical link between cost center and profit center to avoid inconsistencies in reporting and reconciliation (especially in Universal Journal ACDOCA and Asset Accounting). Reversing a posting doesn’t remove the original line from the database — it just adds an offsetting entry — so the system still sees “postings exist” for that validity period.

The SAP notes what you tried 3477968, 3514994, 3567063 are part of SAP’s delivery of the Profit Center Reorganization functionality and related message control. They introduce new message numbers (like 297, 165) that can be set to warning in OBA5 to allow changes under certain conditions. In FPS01, those message numbers weren’t yet delivered and they appear only from FPS02 onwards, which is why you can’t find them in OBA5 in your system.

Since the message control entries aren’t in your release, you have three main paths:

Option A – Use Profit Center Reorganization
This is the supported way to change profit center assignments for master data with historical postings.

  • In On‑Premise, you can activate and run the Profit Center Reorganization process (transaction FAGL_REORG* family).
  • It creates transfer postings in the Universal Journal to move balances from the old profit center to the new one as of a key date.

Option B – Create a new cost center

  • If reorg is too heavy for your case, create a new cost center with the correct profit center and change assignments in dependent objects (e.g., work centers, internal orders, assets).
  • Close the old cost center for postings.

Option C – Upgrade to FPS02 or apply targeted SAP Notes

  • FPS02 delivers the message control for 297 and 165, allowing you to set them to warning in OBA5.
  • If you can’t upgrade, check with SAP Support if they can provide a down‑ported correction for FPS01 to deliver those message numbers.

entry.title: ABAP AI Revolution Accelerates: The ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps in Minutes
entry.content:
The ABAP AI revolution just got a massive functionality upgrade and stays FREE OF CHARGE for another year

Remember John, our seasoned ABAP developer who discovered the power of Joule for AI-assisted coding? His journey has taken an incredible turn. What started as relief from "quick questions" and real-time assistance has evolved into something he never imagined possible – building entire applications and transforming legacy systems through conversation in minutes. 

John's incredible journey is about to accelerate even further with game-changing news: Joule for Developers remains FREE OF CHARGE for another year – the promotion has been extended with no commercial barriers, allowing every customer and partner to benefit from AI-driven development through material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer is now available not only for the BTP ABAP environments (Steampunk) and SAP Cloud ERP Public, but also to our SAP Cloud ERP Private customers using the latest 2025 release version. For a deep dive in more commercial details see ABAP AI - Chapter 2 blog written by my colleague @AlexanderRother 

See John's ABAP AI complete evolution with 2505, 2508 and 2025 ABAP releases:

  • The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation
  • Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction
  • Seamless Integration with OData Consumption
  • Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

 

The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation

John's latest project required a library application with multiple entities. Opening his package in ADT, he right-clicks and selects "Generate ABAP Repository Objects." The new OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard with Joule Chat appears.

"Create a library application with entities for branches, book stock, users and borrowing information. Generate the appropriate fields which fit the business case for the entities." John prompts.

Within seconds, Joule responds with a comprehensive proposal including all entities, fields, and relationships. One click on "Accept" and the wizard auto-populates all configuration fields. Minutes later, John has a complete, runnable RAP application with data model, behavior definitions, service bindings, and OData services ready for UI consumption.

Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction

But the magic doesn't stop at application generation. John's application needs sophisticated business logic – validations for booking dates, automatic stock calculations, and borrowing permission determinations.

Navigating to his behavior implementation class, John finds empty method stubs for his determinations and validations. The RAP Predict Business Logic capability kicks in, understanding the entity structure, field relationships, and business context to generate complete validation logic within the method implementation.

"It's not just generating code," John marvels. "It's understanding the business context and implementing proper RAP patterns automatically."

Seamless Integration with OData Consumption

When John needs to integrate with external booking services, he opens his service consumption model and starts the Joule chat with the /consume slash command. The OData consumption capability generates complete, ready-to-use ABAP code for consuming OData calls via the OData Client Proxy, tailored to his specific service model. 

What used to take hours of documentation reading now happens in seconds with Joule providing example prompts and OData request generation.

Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public

As business requirements evolve, the Extensibility AI Assistant guides John through adding custom fields for regulatory compliance. It assists him in:

  • Creating Custom Fields for borrowing information
  • Finding Business Contexts for the right extension points
  • Enabling Usages where custom fields can be exposed in UIs, APIs, and analytical views
  • Enabling Business Scenarios for data flow between business objects
  • Finding Value Help Views for code list-based custom fields
  • Finding BAdIs based on natural language input

The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 release, John faces his organization's biggest challenge: migrating 15 years of custom ECC code to SAP ERP Cloud Private 2025. The Custom Code Migration AI Assistant will transforms this experience (on October 2025 planned release).  These use cases are currently not available on the older releases, however the use cases delivered on 2025 versions will be soon provided also as part of the Custom Code Migration Application which is a standalone BTP ABAP environment (Steampunk) application which can connect freely to any ERP OnPrem or Cloud system to support RISE migrations. 

  • Using the Explain Capability: "Explain this legacy report," John types, selecting a 500-line ABAP program. The Explain capability provides detailed explanations of the ABAP program, breaking down complex concepts with support for ABAP classes, ABAP programs, and CDS artifacts. 
  • Explain ATC Findings Capability: When running ATC checks with S/4HANA readiness variants, John uses the Explain ATC Findings capability on his S/4HANA readiness findings. This capability provides detailed explanations and step by step resolution proposal on ATC findings from check variants for SAP S/4HANA Readiness, specifically for: S/4HANA: Field Length Extensions, S/4HANA: Search for Database Operations and S/4HANA: Search for Usages and Simplified Objects. Each finding links to simplification items, which Joule explains in detail.
  • Documentation Migration Assistance: Using the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant, John opens the Joule chat view,  type in /docs to start chatting about simplification items related to Custom Code Migration and ABAP SAP Help documentation.  To chat with the assistant about SAP S/4HANA simplification items and Custom Code Migration, just start asking topic-related questions. 
  • With Code proposal for code adaptation coming in SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS01, John will soon receive in addition of the step-by-step description of how to solve the ATC findings provided currently by ATC Explain functionality and a custom code adaptation automatically. 

The Complete ABAP Lifecycle Revolution

John's journey now encompasses the entire ABAP development and transformation lifecycle:

  • Build new cloud applications with OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard
  • Implement intelligent business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic
  • Integrate seamlessly with OData consumption
  • Extend dynamically with Extensibility AI Assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • Transform existing solutions with Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for RISE in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

John tells now to everyone: "Six months ago, I was struggling with syntax," John explains to his manager. entry.title: Re: Cash-Flow Report with Document Types
entry.content:
Hi Meliskulbay,

I understood that you want to use FI document type to segregate amounts between cash flow statement rows. For me, the best way to create a cash flow statement is using reporting rules and even if you add FI document type in ACDOCU you won't be able to use it in reporting rules. This is the reason that I suggested to use transaction types (subitems)

entry.title: Problem with activation of Business function (BS sets are not activated automatically)
entry.content:
Good day, we have new fresh system S/4HANA 2023 FPS03.

After initial configuration of system we tried to activate business function EA-HR (one of the main BF's) via standard SFW5 transaction.

But activation was not successful,  we got errors:

in text: 

Error when comparing BC Set EA-HR-AKH with customizing tables

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Activation of BC Set EA-HR-AKH terminated

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Error when comparing BC Set EA-HR-IMG with customizing tables

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Activation of BC Set EA-HR-IMG terminated

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Error when comparing BC Set EA-HR-MENU with customizing tables

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Activation of BC Set EA-HR-MENU terminated

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed"

If we check problem BC set EA-HR-AKH in SCPR20 transaction, we can see no activations logs:

Looks like SFW5 didn't try to activate it.

SFW_BROWSER shows next:

 

We have double checked all prerequisites:

1. User has SAP_ALL auth.

2. Client role is 'Customizing'.

3. System modifiable (SE06).

Also  Sapnotes  2313533 - SFW5: Termination of activation process,  

2313533 - SFW5: Termination of activation process, 

2770392 - SFW_BROWSER: This object is switched inconsistently  have been checked.

If you have any suggestions please help me.

Thanks in advance!

PS: Sorry for text formatting, I didn't find how to remove spaces between lines in new editor.

entry.title: How To CheckIn URL Attachment with API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV CreateUrlAsAttachment
entry.content:
Hi All, 

With this API I can successfully create URL Original in the Document Info Record, However that created URL Original is not checked In, How to do CheckIn with this API ? I dont see any parameter in this API to do CheckIn ? Is there any Other API which could do CheckIn as well ?

Enclosed the Successful Call with which the URL Original was created.

https://server:44300/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV/CreateUrlAsAttachment?BusinessObjectTypeName='DRAW'&LinkedSAPObjectKey='ART000000000000005000000002701000'&Url='https://test.com'&UrlDescription='Link'&MIMEType='text/url'

As it can be seen in the Screenshot below, the Original was not locked, which means it is not checked In. 

Any Hint, how can i achieve this Lock along with the creation of the URL attachment.

 

 

BR,

Ketan
